ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I went into this class knowing next to nothing about Monastic Life and came out feeling like I could really discuss monasticism with people in an intelligent way. I got to learn a lot about meditation, mindfulness and discipline.

I learned a lot about monastic traditions in this class. I think the class was specifically useful for learning more about Buddhism and its monastic practices, as these were more foreign to me from the beginning. The visits to the monasteries were the cherries on top. I also learned a lot about myself through the monastic experience project.
the concepts of monasticism and why monks do what they do

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: This course was amazing. Danny is an amazing professor and the assignments are quite easy. I wish we meditated before every class. That is the only change I would make.
Danny was a big strength. Great educator and kept us very engaged.
Maybe stricter facilitation of discussion in class

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Absolutely. It is going to be hard to get into this class but try your best because it was the best class. So lowkey and relaxing. Broke up my week so well and offered a welcome contrast to the kind of intellectual rigor of other courses. This one was spiritual, kind and supportive.
Yes! Great class, interesting people, great professor.

This was an excellent class! Danny was a great professor that facilitated an environment conducive to sharing and learning. This was one of the best seminars I have taken at Yale, because it's had a profound impact on my semester both inside and outside the classroom. The Monastic Experience Project  was the culmination of the class and it was an amazing experience!
